Definition: a primitive root; to slaughter (in sacrifice or massacre); kill, offer, shoot out, slay, slaughter.
a primitive root; to tread out, i.e. squeeze (grapes); press.
a primitive root; to sink or depress (reflexive or causative); bend, bow (down), bring (cast) down, couch, humble self, be (bring) low, stoop.
from {{h7812}}; pit; pit.
from {{h7835}}; dinginess, i.e. perhaps soot; coal.
or שְׂחֹק; from {{h7832}}; laughter (in merriment or defiance); derision, laughter(-ed to scorn, -ing), mocked, sport.
from {{h7811}}; a pond (for swimming); to swim in.

a primitive root; to depress, i.e. prostrate (especially reflexive, in homage to royalty or God); bow (self) down, crouch, fall down (flat), humbly beseech, do (make) obeisance, do reverence, make to stoop, worship.
a primitive root; to swim; causatively, to inundate; (make to) swim.
from {{h7809}}; a donation (venal or redemptive); bribe(-ry), gift, present, reward.
from {{h7896}}; a dress (as put on); attire.
a primitive root; to place (in a very wide application); apply, appoint, array, bring, consider, lay (up), let alone, × look, make, mark, put (on),   regard, set, shew, be stayed, × take.
or שׁוּשַׁק; of Egyptian derivation; Shishak, an Egyptian king; Shishak.
from the same as {{h7893}}; whiteness; Shisha, an Israelite; Shisha.
from an unused root meaning to bleach, i.e. whiten;	See {{h8336}}.; white, i.e. marble.
or feminine שִׁירָה; from {{h7891}}; a song; abstractly, singing; musical(-ick), × sing(-er, -ing), song.

or (the original form) שׁוּר; (1 Samuel 18:6), a primitive root (rather identical with {{h7788}} through the idea of strolling minstrelsy); to sing; behold (by mistake for {{h7789}}), sing(-er, -ing man, -ing woman).
from an unused root meaning to urinate; urine; piss.
from {{h5526}} in the sense of {{h7753}}; a brier (as of a hedge); prick.
from {{h7896}}; scrub or trash, i.e. wild growth of weeds or briers (as if put on the field); thorns.
for {{h7879}}; communion, i.e. (reflexively) meditation; thought.
a primitive root; to donate, i.e. bribe; hire, give a reward.
(Aramaic) of foreign origin; a Shushankite (collectively) or inhabitants of some unknown place in Assyrian; Susanchites.

or (plural of former) שׁוֹשַׁנִּים עֵדוּתlemma שׁוֹשַׁנִּיס עֵדוּת samekh, corrected to שׁוֹשַׁנִּים עֵדוּת; from {{h7799}} and {{h5715}}; lily (or trumpet) of assemblage; Shushan-Eduth or Shoshannim-Eduth, the title of a popular song; Shoshannim-Eduth, Shushan-eduth.
probably from {{h7582}} and the same as {{h8520}}; crash of breakage; Shuthelach, the name of two Israelites; Shuthelah.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h5800}}; to leave, i.e. (causatively) free; deliver.
a primitive root; to tan (by sunburning); figuratively (as if by a piercing ray) to scan; look up, see.
a primitive root; to twist (a thread of straw); twine.
from {{h7817}}; sunk, i.e. downcast; humble.
from {{h7878}}; a shoot (as if uttered or put forth), i.e. (generally) shrubbery; bush, plant, shrub.
feminine of {{h7879}}; reflection; by extension, devotion; meditation, prayer.
for {{h7745}}; a pit-fall; pit.
or שִׁחוֹר; or שִׁחֹר; probably from {{h7835}}; dark, i.e. turbid; Shichor, a stream of Egypt; Shihor, Sihor.
from the same as {{h7883}} and {{h3835}}; darkish whiteness; Shichor-Libnath, a stream of Palestine; Shihor-libnath.
from {{h7751}}; also (compare {{h7752}}); an oar; a scourge (figuratively); oar, scourge.
from {{h7951}}; tranquil; Shiloh, an epithet of the Messiah; Shiloh.
or שִׁלֹה; or שִׁילוֹ; or שִׁלוֹ; from the same as {{h7886}}; Shiloh, a place in Palestine; Shiloh.
or שִׁילֹנִי; or שִׁלֹנִי; from {{h7887}}; a Shilonite or inhabitant of Shiloh; Shilonite.
apparently for {{h3452}}; desert; Shimon, an Israelite; Shimon.
from {{h7878}}; a contemplation; by implication, an utterance; babbling, communication, complaint, meditation, prayer, talk.
a primitive root; to ponder, i.e. (by implication) converse (with oneself, and hence, aloud) or (transitively) utter; commune, complain, declare, meditate, muse, pray, speak, talk (with).
from {{h7874}}; lime (as boiling when slacked); lime, plaister.
a primitive root probably meaning to boil up (compare {{h7736}}); used only as denominative from {{h7875}}; to plaster; plaister.
of unknown derivation; Shiza, an Israelite; Shiza.
a primitive root; to keep in memory; be unmindful. (Render Deuteronomy 32:18, 'A Rock bore thee, thou must recollect; and (yet) thou hast forgotten,' etc.)
from {{h3427}}; residence; while...lay.
by permutation from {{h7725}}; a return (of property); captivity.
from {{h7734}}; a withdrawal (into a private place); pursuing.
feminine of {{h7869}}; old age; (be) gray (grey hoar,-y) hairs (head,-ed), old age.
from {{h5526}} in the sense of {{h7753}}; a booth (as interlaced); tabernacle.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h7867}}; elder.
from {{h7867}}; old age; age.
from the same as {{h7722}}; ruin; Shijon, a place in Palestine; Shihon.
a primitive root; properly, to become aged, i.e. (by implication) to grow gray; (be) grayheaded.
for {{h7724}}; Sheja, an Israelite; Sheva (from the margin).
from {{h7863}}; peak; Sion, the summit of Mount Hermon; Sion.
probably from {{h7737}}; a gift (as available); present.
from the same as {{h7721}} by permutation; elevation; excellency.
active participle of an otherwise unused root probably meaning to write; properly, a scribe, i.e. (by analogy or implication) an official superintendent or magistrate; officer, overseer, ruler.
from the same as {{h7860}}; magisterial; Shitrai, an Israelite; Shitrai.
(Aramaic) of uncertain derivation; a side; side.
or שֵׁטֶף; from {{h7857}}; a deluge (literally or figuratively); flood, outrageous, overflowing.
a primitive root; to attack, (figuratively) accuse; (be an) adversary, resist.
a primitive root; properly, to lurk for, i.e. persecute; hate, oppose self against.
the same as the plural of {{h7848}}; acacia trees; Shittim, a place East of the Jordan; Shittim.
active participle of an otherwise unused root meaning (properly, to pierce; but only as a denominative from {{h7752}}); to flog; a goad; scourge.
a primitive root; to gush; by implication, to inundate, cleanse; by analogy, to gallop, conquer; drown, (over-) flow(-whelm, rinse, run, rush, (throughly) wash (away).
the same as {{h7855}}; Sitnah, the name of a well in Pal; Sitnah.
from {{h7853}}; opposition (by letter); accusation.
from {{h7853}}; an opponent; especially (with the article prefixed) Satan, the arch-enemy of good; adversary, Satan, withstand.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h7843}}; corrupt, fault.
from {{h7743}}; a pit (especially as a trap); figuratively, destruction; corruption, destruction, ditch, grave, pit.
or סֵט; from {{h7750}}; a departure from right, i.e. sin; revolter, that turn aside.
a primitive root; to deviate from duty; decline, go aside, turn.
from {{h7835}}; swarthy; black.
from {{h7836}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has sought; Shecharjah, an Israelite; Shehariah.
dual of {{h7837}}; double dawn; Shacharajim, an Israelite; Shaharaim.
a primitive root; to decay, i.e. (causatively) ruin (literally or figuratively); batter, cast off, corrupt(-er, thing), destroy(-er, -uction), lose, mar, perish, spill, spoiler, × utterly, waste(-r).
feminine of a derivative (only in the plural שִׁטִּים; meaning the sticks of wood) from the same as {{h7850}}; the acacia (from its scourging thorns); shittah, shittim. See also {{h1029}}.
a primitive root; to expand; all abroad, enlarge, spread, stretch out.
from the same as {{h7830}}; proudly; Shachatsom, a place in Palestine; Shahazimah (from the margin).
from an unused root apparently meaning to strut; haughtiness (as evinced by the attitude); × lion, pride.
a primitive root; to comminate (by trituration or attrition); beat, wear.
a primitive root; to laugh (in pleasure or detraction); by implication, to play; deride, have in derision, laugh, make merry, mock(-er), play, rejoice, (laugh to) scorn, be in (make) sport.
a primitive root (identical with {{h7836}} through the idea of the duskiness of early dawn); to be dim or dark (in color); be black.
from {{h7833}}; a powder (as beaten small); by analogy, a thin vapor; by extension, the firmament; cloud, small dust, heaven, sky.
from {{h7836}}; dawn (literal, figurative or adverbial); day(-spring), early, light, morning, whence riseth.

a primitive root; properly, to dawn, i.e. (figuratively) be (up) early at any task (with the implication of earnestness); by extension, to search for (with painstaking); (do something) betimes, enquire early, rise (seek) betimes, seek diligently) early, in the morning).
from {{h7836}}; a dawning, i.e. (figuratively) juvenescence; youth.
or שָׁחוֹר; from {{h7835}}; properly, dusky, but also (absol.) jetty; black.
from an unused root probably meaning to burn; inflammation, i.e. an ulcer; boil, botch.
or סָחִישׁ; from an unused root apparently meaning to sprout; after-growth; (that) which springeth of the same.
a primitive root (identical with {{h7819}} through the idea of striking); to hammer out; beat.
from {{h7819}}; slaughter; killing.
from an unused root probably meaning to roar; a lion (from his characteristic roar); (fierce) lion.
apparently from the same as {{h7826}} through some obscure idea, perhaps that of peeling off by concussion of sound; a scale or shell, i.e. the aromatic mussel.; onycha.
from the same as {{h7828}}; a board (as chipped thin); cieled with.
from {{h7812}}; a pit-fall (literally or figuratively); destruction, pit.
from an unused root meaning to peel, i.e. emaciate; the gull (as thin); cuckoo.
from the same as {{h7828}}; emaciation; consumption.
